Question
========

29% of Internet users sometimes download movies, 67% of downloaders do not care if they are copyrighted. Suppose A = {internet users who download movies}; B = {downloaders who don't care about copyright} Then how likely is it that we will randomly choose an Internet user who downloads movies when he doesn't care care whether they are copyrighted?

Answerlist
----------

* 0,19
* 0,29
* 0,67
* 0.96

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.19: Correct
* 0.29: Incorrect
* 0.67: Incorrect
* 0.96: Incorrect
